project.title: Audition Certificates Platform
project.project_desc: The ACP transcribes audition certificates in Arabic manuscripts and links them to the digital reproductions as far as they are available. These certificates, found in manuscript books, provide rich historical data on authorized text transmissions, and the ACP's digital efforts aim to systematically explore libraries like Staatsbibliothek Berlin, Forschungsbibliothek Gotha, The Bibliothèque nationale de France, and the Syrian National Library to create a searchable corpus, offering unique insights into Middle Eastern social, economic, and urban history, as well as biographical studies.

project.comment: The sustainability of the data is ensured in two ways: first, through the ZFDM Repository at Universität Hamburg, and second, by its integration into the Bibliotheca Arabica database. This research data will be utilized to train machine learning models for the automatic recognition of audition certificates in Arabic manuscripts and their specific components.
